GranicusMatter.MatterEXText10: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, the first meeting of 1998 of the Council of the city of New York is scheduled for Wednesday, January 7, 1998 at 12:00 noon, in the Council Chamber, second floor, City Hall, New York, New York.

GranicusMatter.MatterEXText10: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: Please be hereby advised that the following named persons were elected Members of the City Council of New York on November 4, 1997.

By Council Member Berman:
"I hereby nominate for the Office of the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter, for the term commencing January 1, 1998 and terminating December 31, 2001, Council Member Peter F. Vallone."

GranicusMatter.MatterEXText10: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: We the undersigned, duly elected Michael J. Abel, Andrew S. Eristoff, Stephn J. Fiala, John A. Fusco, Martin Golden, Thomas V. Ognibene and Alfonso Stabile, Minority Members of the Council of the City of New York, purusant to Rule 4.10 of the Rules of the City Council of New York do hereby designate and appoint as Minority Leader of the City Council Thomas V. Ognibene, Borough of Queens for a term commencing on January 1, 1998.

By the Speaker:
"Motion that pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 1994-1997 Rules of the Council as maended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or said rules shall be otherwise amended or modified".

GranicusMatter.MatterName: Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elctions by the Speaker: "I nominate the following Council Members as Members of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections of the City Council: Morton Povman, Chair Eisland Spigner O'Donovan Berman Wooten Foster Freed Michels Ognibene Vallone".

GranicusMatter.MatterName: New York City Corporate Welfare, Hearings

GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: Resolution supporting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the Israel Government's position, as agreed to by then Secretary of State Warren Christopher, that the scope of any land withdrawal by Israel must be determined exclusively by Israel based on its security needs to protect its citizens from terrorist attacks and to defend its borders.

Resolution calling upon the United States Environment Protection Agency (USEPA) to expedite the completion of its Hudson River Reassessment currently being conducted under the federal Superfund Law and to urge the USEPA to propose a Hudson River remediation plan and issue a Record of Decision before the end of the year 2000.

Resolution declaring the month of April 1998, National Infant Immunization Month.

GranicusMatter.MatterName: Parking, Alternate Side Suspension Purim etc.
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the religious holidays of Purim and Ash Wednesday.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the letting of sleeping rooms in hotels and motels.
Resolution recognizing the nation's professional social workers and commemorating the profession's centennial year.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York in relation to speed limits near schools.

Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Legislature to enact A9357 which amends the penal law to include the financial exploitation of the elderly or disabled within the crime of larceny.

GranicusMatter.MatterName: Parking, Alternate Side Suspension Jewish Holidays
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules after certain Jewish holidays.

Application no. 308098 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Project located at 722, 724, 730, 732, 734 11th Avenue and 562, 562 1/2, 564 West 52nd Street; Council District no. 3, Borough of Manhattan. This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development.

Resolution calling upon the Governor and the New York State Legislature to amend Article VI, of the State Public Health Law, to increase the State reimbursement rate for loccal public health expenditures to 40 percent for all services eligible for reimbursement under Article VI, and to appropriate funds in the State Fiscal 1998-99 Budget sufficient to reimburse localities at this increased rate.

GranicusMatter.MatterName: Medical Records, Office of the Medical Examiner
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the department of public health, to repeal and reenact section 556 of the charter relating to the functions, powers and duties of the department of public health, to repeal section 568 of the charter concerning creation of an addiction programs advisory counsel, and to repeal mental retardation and alcoholism services, and in relation to the authority of the chief medical examiner to require the attendance of persons and the production of medical records in investigations under the jurisdiction of the office of chief medical examiner.

GranicusMatter.MatterName: Body Piercing By Minor Prohibited, Parental Consent
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting piercing the body of a minor without parental consent.
Resolution calling upon New York Sate Legislature to create a Temporary Commission on Public and Private Health Care.
Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the City Council to conduct an oversight hearing on childhood lead poisoning in New York City.

GranicusMatter.MatterName: In Rem, Don and Judy Bishoff, Staten Island (S.6632, A.10021)
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills, introduced by Senator Marchi, S6632, and Assembly Members Straniere, et al, A10021, "An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Staten Island to former owners Don and Judy Bishoff, without public auction and notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thsu acquired; Block No. 5433, Lot No. 75 on tax map for the borough of Staten Island."

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget-Transfer of $156,000 in Fiscal Year 1998 from the budget of the Office of the Brooklyn Borough President to various City agencies, pusuant to Section 107 (b) of the New York City Charter.

GranicusMatter.MatterEXText10: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
GranicusMatter.MatterName: Budget Priorities, Staten Island Borough President
GranicusMatter.MatterTitle: Communication from the Staten Island Borough President, Pursuant to Section 241 of the City Charter, submitting Staten Island's Budget Priorities for Fiscal Year 1999.

Pursuant to Rule 11.20B of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action fo the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number 970339 PQK shall be subject to review by the Council.
